intro: Bilderdykia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in a daisy-like pattern. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
